Back-to-school FAQs‼️
Q: How do I register my student(s) for in-person or virtual learning?
A: Register your student here: www.normandysc.org/OnlineRegistration. Step-by-step directions and a video are available for assistance. Register ASAP!

Q: Will my student(s) be going to school virtually or in person?
A: K-4th grades have the option for in-person or virtual learning. Grades 5-12 will be all virtual learning.

Q: Will my student(s) receive a Chromebook for virtual learning?
A: Yes, all students will receive a Chromebook for virtual learning. Parents will be notified soon with information on pick-up dates and times.

Q: What schools supplies does my student(s) need?
A: Please visit the Back to School section on the Normandy website for details, www.normandysc.org.

Q: Will my student(s) receive a face mask?
A: Yes, all student(s) and staff will receive up to five washable cloth face coverings. Extra will be available if needed.

For more information, please visit the Return to Learn section on our website at www.normandysc.org. #NormandyStrong

Congratulations to Normandy High School class of 2020 graduate Remy Johnson! The senior class president, who plans to attend Lincoln University and major in criminal justice, is the first generation of his family to go to college.

Remy credits the Viking Advantage program at Normandy High with helping him stay on track throughout the college application process. Viking Advantage provides a savings plan for college by setting students up with an Individual Development Account. Each dollar the student deposits is matched three to one, up to a maximum of $500 (for a match of $1,500). Participants also receive ACT prep support, assistance with college financial aid applications, entrance exam fees, and mentorship.

All of us at Beyond Housing salute your accomplishment, Remy, and wish you the best of luck at college!

Read more: https://bit.ly/2YCnvmX

Last Friday, we were scheduled to celebrate our bright stars of the district at the annual Friends of Normandy School District Scholarship Gala. The Gala is the primary fundraiser for FON, which provides needed scholarships for graduating Normandy seniors. But like so many things in the last 6 weeks, coronavirus cancelled the party -- but we still have deserving students who need our support.

Thursday, May 7 is Give STL Day, a day set aside for nonprofits in the area to receive financial support for their respective causes. If you were planning to attend the Gala this year, you can still support our students. Make a donation to the Friends of Normandy on Give STL Day by making a donation at https://www.givestlday.org/friendsnormandy
#NormandyStrong #VikingPride #scholarships

The Normandy Joint Executive Governing Board has selected Marcus Robinson as its next Superintendent of Schools! Robinson will begin his new role with Normandy May 1, 2020.

Mr. Robinson comes to Normandy from The Opportunity Trust, where he served as the group’s Executive in Residence. In this role, Robinson worked as the systems-level education administration fellow, responsible for district and school support in urban education innovation. A St. Louis native, Mr. Robinson is a veteran educator who has earned a reputation as a turnaround specialist in urban school districts. His prior experience includes his role as the Chief Executive Officer for the Memphis Education Fund, and Chancellor & CEO for the Tindley Accelerated Schools in Indianapolis, Indiana. His teaching experience includes roles at Cathedral High School in Indianapolis, and Jennings Junior High School in St. Louis County. #NormandyStrong #VikingPride

To read the full announcement, please go here: https://bit.ly/2XWdG4B

CORONAVIRUS UPDATE: In line with the ‘stay-at-home’ directive issued by local and state government officials to help mitigate the spread of COVID-19, area superintendents have made the decision to continue the current school closure until Wednesday, April 22. This extended closure includes the Normandy Schools Collaborative. During the extended school closure, the Collaborative will continue to provide meals, virtual learning plans, and other services to students and families.

Meals for Students: Beginning Monday, March 23, Normandy will provide grab-and-go breakfasts and lunches for students. Meals will be dropped off with students/families at bus stops throughout the district beginning at 10 a.m. Meals will also be available at drive-through pick up locations at each school (except CASA) between the hours of 11 a.m. & 12:30 p.m.

For more information on the off-site learning and meal distributions, please go here: www.normandysc.org/covid19 #NormandyStrong
